text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today i am 
making dessert now this dessert was inspired by a

Thai Street food called gluay ping gluay is banana 
and ping means to grill and so it's grilled Namwa

bananas which is the short little guys and they 
pour it over with this coconut palm sugar syrup

but since I can't find fresh Namwa bananas here 
I've modified it to become basically a Bananas

Foster except it uses what I'm going to call a 
coconut butterscotch sauce instead mmm so good

let's get started all right so I've got just a 
saute pan here and I'm going to go in with some

butter and butter just makes everything better 
now traditionally we don't always put butter in it

at the very basic level it's simply coconut milk 
and palm sugar but some vendors do add butter so

to that I'm also going to add some palm sugar now 
this is the star here this is why this dessert is

so good I'm going to let it dissolve this tastes 
good already but I'm going to deepen the flavor

by letting it caramelize until it's darkened 
into sort of a brown butterscotchy color all

right so it's starting to turn brown now now 
we're getting brown butter which is delicious

and nutty and we're also getting some of the 
sugar starting to brown so I have to watch it

very carefully and when it's the desired color 
go in with the coconut milk and the sugar is

gonna seize up and solidifies that's okay that's 
normal because suddenly it's very cold now in the

pan and it'll slowly dissolve into the sauce 
again so don't panic mmm that just looks like

good caramel to make this even better I'm going 
to add a little kick to it coconut flavored rum

now this is optional if you want to sort of 
accentuate the banana flavor you can also add

some kinda banana now traditionally with Bananas 
Foster they add some high-proof alcohol and light

the whole thing on fire and flambe it you can 
do that if you want but I'm going to get that

today always always a pinch of salt specially 
Thai dessert there's always a contrast not a

contrast but a supporting role from salt in all 
of our desserts that's almost done I'm going to

stop it for now it still got a little bit to 
go but I'm going to stop it for now and cut my

banana let's talk banana the perfect banana for 
this is actually one that still has a little bit

of green running down the length of the banana 
if it's too right but it'll be too mushy and it

also be almost too sweet this one still has a 
little bit of an acidity to it contrasts well

with the sweet sauce now if you want you can also 
do sweet plantains okay I'll add the instructions

for what to do if you're using plantains in the 
written recipe but that's a delicious delicious

way to do it and it's actually very similar to 
our Thai version really long slices on a bias so

it's nice long pieces so it looks pretty this 
piece is a little bit bruised that's okay I'm

just going to eat it let's turn this back on and 
we're almost done by the way Oh smells so good

you wouldn't believe it I'm going to go in with 
the banana spread it out and you just want to

cook the banana real quickly toss them into the 
syrup and let it warm through but you really do

not want to overcook it because the bananas 
will go mushy really really quickly you can

base the bananas or you can just flip it like I'm 
doing don't let it go for too long otherwise the

the syrup will be too dry and I'm pretty happy 
with that I'm gonna turn it off and it's done I

gotta get my ice cream ready vanilla ice cream 
is best I think you can use coconut ice cream

if you're really into things being very coconutty 
you know I'm just gonna do one for now in reality

I want a lot alright and the banana and the 
syrup goes on top oh my god that looks good Oh

I'm also going to put a little bit of chopped 
peanuts on top because if you've been your

toilet you know that we always put peanuts 
on our ice cream and it gives that nutty

crunch to contrast everything ah looks so 
good I'm so excited it's incredible it's

like Bananas Foster but better I do can't 
describe it it's so rich and sweet and at

the same time really complex you saw how easy 
that was so there's no excuse for not making it

so do give this a try and send me a photo on 
Facebook Twitter or Instagram and the recipe

is on hot Thai Kitchen comm and I will see you 
next time for your next delicious Thai meal Oh
